list_page_teaser: Lost was an interesting show with many fascinating characters.  Click to see the Spiritual Portraits of a few of them!
description_html:
This page currently has only two portraits, and they are distinct opposites. Fans of the show — even those who haven't seen it in years — should remember both Charlie Pace and Mr. Eko.

Look for more characters to be added soon!
story_html:
I will be adding more characters from Lost soon.

To keep up to date, follow this site on social media or join the SeeOurMinds.com email list!

image_list.title: Mr. Eko
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Mr. Eko's dominant trait, his idealism.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He demonstrates this trait by ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Mr. Eko's auxiliary trait, his rationality.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He demonstrates this trait by ....

image_list.title: Charlie Pace
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Charlie's dominant trait, his pragmatism.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He demonstrates this trait by ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Charlie's auxiliary trait, his passion.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He demonstrates this trait by ....
